_Remarks.casr-v31: Original variable names are following the convention <Product>_<Type:A=Analysis,P=Prediction>_<ECCC name>_<Level/Tile/Category>. Variables with level '10000' are at surface level. The height [m] of variables with level '0XXXX' needs to be inferrred using the corresponding fields of geopotential height (GZ_0XXXX-GZ_10000). The variables UUC, VVC, UVC, and WDC are not modelled but inferred from UU and VV for convenience of the users. Precipitation (PR) is reported as 6-hr accumulations for CaPA_fine and CaPA_coarse. Precipitation (PR) are accumulations since beginning of the forecast for GEPS, GDPS, REPS, RDPS, HRDPS, and CaLDAS. The re-analysis product CaSR_v3.1 contains two variables for precipitation: 'CaSR_v3.1_P_PR0_SFC' is the model precipitation (trial field used by CaPA) and 'CaSR_v3.1_A_PR0_SFC' is precipitations adjusted with CaPA 24h precipitation (as in 'RDRS_P_PR0_SFC'). Please be aware that the baseflow 'O1' of the current version of WCPS is not reliable during the spring melt period.

Header.terms_of_use: Canadian Surface Reanalysis data users should acknowledge The Canadian Surface Prediction Archive (CaSPAr) as the original data source (https://caspar-data.ca/, https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-19-0143.1)

A_PR0_SFC.comments: Converted from Total Precipitation using a density of 1000 kg/m³.

P_GZ_SFC.description: Surface coordinate (10000) on the GEM Charney-Phillips vertical grid (https://doi.org/10.1175/MWR-D-13-00255.1). The height of variables with level 0XXXX can be inferred zcrd0XXXX - zcrd10000.
P_GZ_SFC.long_name: Model vertical grid coordinate at the surface

P_PR0_SFC.comments: Converted from Total Precipitation using a density of 1000 kg/m³.
P_PR0_SFC.description: This field differs from the 'pr' variable. It is the model background field subsequently used by CaPA to produce 'pr'.

P_RN0_SFC.comments: Converted from Total Liquid Precipitation using a density of 1000 kg/m³.

P_SN0_SFC.comments: Converted from Total Snow amount using a density of 1000 kg/m³.

A_CFIA_SFC.long_name: Analysis: Confidence Index of CaPA 24h Analysis at surface

P_GZ_09975.description: Corresponding coordinate (09975) on the GEM Charney-Phillips vertical grid (https://doi.org/10.1175/MWR-D-13-00255.1). The height of variables with level 0XXXX can be inferred zcrd0XXXX - zcrd10000.

P_HR_09975.description:
The approximate 20 metre level is more specifically 99.75% of the atmosphere based on pressure elevation, where 100% is the surface. 
The true height needs to be inferred using the corresponding fields on the Charney-Phillips vertical grid (zcrd09975 - zcrd1000) (https://doi.org/10.1175/MWR-D-13-00255.1)
P_HR_09975.long_name: 20 metre Relative Humidity (height is approximate :  see description)

P_HU_09975.description:
The approximate 20 metre level is more specifically 99.75% of the atmosphere based on pressure elevation, where 100% is the surface. 
The true height needs to be inferred using the corresponding fields on the Charney-Phillips vertical grid (zcrd09975 - zcrd1000) (https://doi.org/10.1175/MWR-D-13-00255.1)
P_HU_09975.long_name: 20 metre Specific Humidity (height is approximate :  see description)

P_TD_09975.long_name: 20 metre dewpoint temperature (height is approximate :  see description)

P_UUC_09975.long_name: Eastward Wind (20m). Height is approximate, see description.

P_FR0_SFC.comments: Converted from Total Freezing Rain using a density of 1000 kg/m³.

P_PE0_SFC.comments: Converted from Total Refrozen Rain using a density of 1000 kg/m³.
